intro: Espostoopsis dybowskii subsp. contasensis, commonly known as the Contasensis spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial herb native to the Andean regions of South America, specifically Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
